name: Keep IT alive - The daily struggle
name_original: Keep IT alive - The daily struggle
description:
Description

You are the IT guy in a small company. It is already evening and you look forward to your after-work hours. Hoping your work day will soon end, you are currently in your office caring about your plant. But of course, your stupid colleagues call you all the time, so can resolve their trivial problems. The only way to survive the evening is coffee. A lot of coffee.

Gameplay

Your goal is to hold out as long as possible. Therefore, it is necessary to fulfil the tasks of your colleagues. This will keep your reputation high. If you fail too often, your colleagues are going to complain about you and eventually you will get fired. You also have to keep your caffeine in check. To stay awake, you have to drink coffee, but beware too much isn’t healthy as well.

Controls

WSAD - move
F - interact with your environment
SPACE - dash
1 - accept task
2 - decline task
ESC - quit to main menu
If you want to mute the music, press M in-game.
If you want to mute the sounds, press N in-game.

Technical Details

The game was made in Java with the libGDX Framework ( https://libgdx.badlogicgames.com/ ). We made all the graphics ourselves, using Illustrator ( https://www.adobe.com/de/products/illustrator.html ), Photoshop (https://www.adobe.com/de/products/photoshop.html ) and Tiled ( https://www.mapeditor.org ) for the map. All the sound effects were created with assets of the ‘The #GameAudioGDC Bundle’ (Part 3) (http://www.sonniss.com/gameaudiogdc2017/). The background music is “Aria” by Kimiko Ishizaka from freemusicarchive.org

Made by

Graphics: Janetheodd and Donarr

Programming: Skosnowich and Matjes
